message: Is it as good as people say it is?
Haven't gotten a chance to try it yet.
i saw my nephews play it a little and it seemed pretty cool
i thought i might get one but it's $150 and with no killer Kinect games and the 3DS coming out that's an awful lot
seems like Dance Central and Kinectimals are selling a ton of devices though
Seems pretty cool if it works as advertised
Hard to believe that it does though!
ev and i were talking recently about all the other things you could use it for besides gaming
it seemed to work okay with games
custom clothes over the internet, etc.
@twakefield Ah yeah, kind of like http://joeybuddha.com/320/try-on-virtual-sunglasses-with-ebay-iphone-app-pics/
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEPuEDCpFOQ
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KWbLOFGSEDo
http://www.gamesetwatch.com/2011/01/game_time_with_mister_raroo_fi.php
i haven't kept up with the cool kinect hax from the internet but i understand there are some
heck, one day while I was hanging out at YC, the anybot crew had a roomba rolling around with a kinect strapped on top
I've heard nothing but good things about the kinect
and it's quite hackable, from what I've seen
Some of the games are really fun too - but the biggest benefit has to be the weight loss for me
I've found the kinect great for doing some exercise - I can be pretty lazy but its getting me going
We just got a Wii instead of X-BOX + Kinect. Partly due to price (even thought I'd LOVE to have GTA finally...), but also because there's a ton of fun games already.
I'm still waiting for an *interesting* game that actually lets Kinect shine ... and work well in the confines of my apartment :-P
@zerok heh, its true - it does need some more games. The Kinect Sports is great - that and Your Shape are all I spend time on.

They had one at BarCamp London and me and the girl and three or four others played it quite a bit, and had a lot of fun with it. It works really quite well; not perfect, and it has a reasonably noticeable margin of error at interpreting some commands when you're frantically trying to do whatever the game is asking you to do, more so than the Wii, but it's really a surprisingly fantastic product.
I say surprisingly, because I never 1) expected it to work anywhere near as well as it does, and 2) I never expected this level of physical mimicking to be as fun as it was.
Not, as some might have thought upon reading that, because it was made by Microsoft.
Looks like "Microsoft to release a free SDK for Kinect this spring" - via http://www.physorg.com/news/2011-02-microsoft-free-sdk-kinect.html
@zerok I know what you mean about space - we got the Wii the same day as the couch.. would have been even better in a room with no couch!
I find the new cross purpose on the livingroom weird. I never used to do anything active in the livingroom but that's changing.
It's led to a slightly changing space, where I've had to change the layout and I have adjusted the heating times so that its not too hot in there to work out
Some great Kinect hacks showcased here: http://kinecthacks.net/
Once I move to my new place I'll definitely be accommodating the space for XBOX Kinect action. It is as good as they say, definitely worth it - excited to see what developers will do with it.
